comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: Almost unrecognisable from today (2013).  Manly Vale, North Manly and North Balgowlah look like grazing land. Pittwater Road bisects the scene, the gauntlet tracked tramway bridge to the photographer's right. This shot taken from Queenscliff headland.

comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content:
A 1951 view from Foto Supplies on Flickr:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/oakleystudios/5355572679/in/photostream/]

and more recently from ebroh:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/25846046@N03/3350575214/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: I don't think that is Pittwater Road ?   That bridge is where the current bridge across the lagoon outlet is,   to Queenscliff.    Pittwater Road crosses the lagoon further west.

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mich2009] Sorry Mich I may have confused you. You're right of course the footbridge in the foreground leads to Queenscliff and Freshwater (Harbord). I was referring to the road to the west, you can see the bridges in the middle distance.

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] Andy (and Ebroh) many thanks for the comparison shots. I must go for a clamber on Queenscliff Headland and frame a shot as near as I can to SRA's original - the trouble is that the headland is covered with home unit blocks now!

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: Yeah,  you can see a couple of little bridges in the background where Pittwater road goes around the swamp.
